intro: Jaltomata yungayensis, commonly known as the Yungay morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, such as cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to purple. Jaltomata yungayensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh ecological niche.
